intro: Salpianthus macrodontus, commonly known as the large-toothed salpianthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Its seeds are encased in a pod and can be dispersed by wind or animals. Due to its ornamental value and potential ecological benefits, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
